-- Graham raises $530,000: Rep. Gwen Graham (D-Fla.) raised more than $530,000 in the second quarter for her reelection campaign in a tough, GOP-leaning North Florida swing district, POLITICO Florida’s Marc Caputo reports.

— Democrat looking to challenge Hardy raises $214,000: Ruben Kihuen, one of a crowd of Democrats jockeying to challenge Nevada GOP Rep. Cresent Hardy, raised $214,000 in the second financial quarter, his campaign said.

PRESIDENTIAL SPEED READ — “John Kasich, back on Capitol Hill, fends off doubts about 2016,” by POLITICO’s Alex Isenstadt: More than 14 years after he left Congress, John Kasich was back on the Hill on Tuesday.

— Bera raises $420,000 despite trade bill strife: Rep. Ami Bera (D-Calif.) raised $420,000 in the second quarter of 2015, even as organized labor attacked him for his support for fast-track trade authority.

MAKING IT OFFICIAL — McSally gets a challenger in AZ-02: Democratic state Sen. Victoria Steele confirmed on Tuesday that she would challenge freshman GOP Rep. Martha McSally in Arizona’s 2nd District.
